review: I loved this place. I had an absolute blast here. It was football Sunday, so I was shocked that there were so few people in there... But that's ok because I got to watch the game, in clear view, without feeling too crowded. I loved the atmosphere inside, so from the get go I was feeling pretty good. Even though the hostess wasn't too good because he was on the phone when we walked in and made us wait, as soon as we did get a seat, I thought the tables were all so cool, so many different vibes throughout. It only goes up from here people, so I'm talking to my date about how I'm a vegetarian and at most American burger spots I get a bunch of sides (ex. Spinach and artichoke dip, sweet potato fries, macaroni and cheese, nachos...) and I wasn't necessarily complaining. But as I've already decided the sides I wanted... BAM. VEGGIE BURGER. I was so excited! Not many spots out here have that, so I immediately knew I HAD to try it. Let. Me. Tell. You! I've been a vegetarian 7 years now, and this was by far the BEST veggie burger I have ever had. Vegetarian or not, it's something you want to try just because! My date, airborne, combat infantryman , you know protein beef beef, even admitted it was delicious! Definitely try it! Then, the sauces! They have soooo many choices, it was crazy I tried a bunch and was not disappointed at all. I've overlooked this little gem for so long, but I have now become a regular!  Service was good, food was great, atmosphere was amazing. See you soon Red Robin.

I like Red Robin. I'm a loyalty "royalty" member whatever that means to you. It gets me a free burger on my birthday and they have some really good fries. But this location is on the brink of being closed down. You can tell by the limited staff to keep costs down. The lack of knowledgeable staff possibly due to retention turnover from tenured staff. The lack of care for patrons. Here's an example: before I signed in to write this review a special was available at this location but I was not offered it while purveying the Killeen location. Our bartender was amiable but that's where the buck stops, unfortunately. She wasn't rude in any way shape or form, she was just a bartender. She tended bar. She wasn't there to serve or take care of her guests by any means. My iced tea was done before my appetizer and was only offered one upon asking for our closing tab. Our bottomless fries took two requests to arrive. I wanted a beer but didn't have any face time to actually ask what beers they had to see if they could accommodate my black and tan request. They weren't slammed but they weren't exactly slow either but the time spent in the kitchen by the staff instead of the floor felt more like a UFC Fight Night or major NFL event taking place. No such luck with any type of good service, which is a shame because my best friend used to work here and make quite a living. Seems like the genuine service left with him.  I will take my business to the Cedar Park or Round Rock location because I have very little if any complaints or qualms with them. Even if a bit of a drive away. Shape it up.

We (family of four- two adults and two kids) went for Saturday lunch. Plenty of parking- quickly seated by the hostess. Restaurant is very clean- chalkboard games and a tablet on table to order food/drinks and occupy the kids. Pretty good beer selection and wine list- we had the fried pickles , followed by a burger with blue cheese and portabello mushrroms- good steak fries(bottomless- but I was full after the first) kids enjoyed the mac and cheese and corn dogs Service was friendly and fast-food was hot and well prepared   Overall- it was a pretty solid lunch- we would add this to our short list of lunch places in Killeen

I went to dinner with my friends and their kids a while back ago.  I haven't been to Red Robin in YEARS.  Well, I realized that I'm not really missing out.  The menu is as big as Cheesecake Factory but just burgers and fries.  It's really confusing because they have different "types" of burgers but they don't really explain what the differences are.  Some are larger, some are smaller, some may be a different quality of beef?  I dunno, it was option paralysis and I wasn't sure I was choosing the right one.  Also, being in Killeen, it's chock full of kids and families, so if you're not into that, avoid this place.  Everything seemed to be in a constant state of dirty too.  Could be because of all of the kids too but it was kind of startling how dirty things seemed.

Red Robin's was a last minute dinner destination. My family actually really enjoyed it. My kids loved their pizzas and bottomless steak fries and macaroni and cheese. The burgers were yummy and the kids loved the dessert. The waitress was attentive and made sure we were taken care of. We'll definitely come again.

Note, it has been several months since we have eaten here and prior experiences were positive. After tonight, which was on a Friday night, we will not return.  Service was good however when a bill is over $70 before tip, for 3 people, you should be served quality food.  Tortilla soup was luke warm in temperature, salsa tasted like ketchup, and fish and chips was super greasy and tasted like it was reheated.  I could have spent same amount of money at a steakhouse. Don't waste your time.

Near death experience!! Would not recommend!! I went to this location with my boyfriend in hopes to receive the same great service I had received in Austin but boy I was beyond disappointed. I ordered a basic bacon cheeseburger but I requested ABSOLUTELY NO TOMATOES due to the fact of my high allergy to them and I emphasize it. I received my burger and of course it had tomato's on it. I had to wait for the waiter to come back and when I told him he said he told them in the back as well as writing it. My boyfriends food was right but mine had to be taken back and it came back out pretty quickly so in my head I did question it but was just going to take a bite but something stopped me. I lifted my bun and moved the lettuce to the side some and seen the tomato seeds in it then when I pushed the lettuce completely off I could see the ring in my cheese where the cook had just pulled the tomato off and sent it back out. I am severely allergic to tomatoes I carry an epipen with me, but that does not help much as I have had to be rushed to hospital and my stomach pumped as well as getting a breathing tube in past experiences. I would never go back here. The fact that they didn't take my allergies serious was too much for me.

My wife and I by fluke tried this location given that we are somewhat fond of good all American food and "gourmet" burgers like Guy Fieri onboard Carnivals ships but given our current location we were a bit limited in options and decided to give it a try. Boy it was a rude awakening, we were highly mistaken. Our experience took place on July 23, 2017 between 5pm to 6:48pm. The waiter was Elisa, the quality and service was worst than drive thru to include other competitive chains with substandard food quality.  I ordered a Smokey BBQ tavern double burger  that astonishingly required to be done three times because they either didn't know the difference between cheddar and pepperjack cheeses; randomly changed the type of buns and finally took out ingredients as if they were treating how many variables they can produce with food products and condiments.  Not trying to nick pick but they cycled through different burger buns as if it was randomly. I initially ordered onion grilled buns but somehow they changed the bread in round 2 when corrected and removed their BBQ sauce from the Smokey "BBQ" burger....in round 3. They slapped a burger that was not what I ordered and it only took about over an hour and 20 minutes to receive.  I had to request their sauce after the third try and created their Smokey BBQ double burger in my table given that either there is no communication in the back or their employees are completely illiterate.  I purposely did not mention how rude individuals were when they brought out my order. It appeared as a manager or supervisor brought out my burger in ciabatta bread and I politely inform her that that couldn't be my burger given that it was ordered in grilled onion buns and the only incorrect thing previously was the cheese. She then said your waiter requested this because you ordered it like this then walked away angry.  The waiter Elisa then mentioned, "oh, I did request ciabatta bread,uh..." Then walked away.  How is the customer at fault for the waiter not doing the basic elementary duties of writing down an order and then reciting or inputting it in their system correctly. I'm not going to waste time going into depth of how there was no service i.e. our drinks ran empty three times while we waited for our food and twice while we ate.  In regards to the dessert, they were modifying or check and we were not even able to order dessert through the table kiosk machine.  Elisa didn't return/service our table after the second incorrect order and we had to flag her when she was attending other tables to get any drinks and to order dessert. We ordered the dessert to go. Don't waste your time, the only pleasant encounter was with a nice lady that brought us the Smokey BBQ sauce that wad supposed to be in the burger. She deserves the star, the service and food quality doesn't deserve a single one.  Funny this is that after leaving both muy wife and I got sick. Nausea, etc. Don't waste your time or money in this establishment. It might possibly be an isolated event however we will not expose or risk further food poisoning by returning.

I first discovered this place back when I was living in North Carolina. So when I saw that Harker Heights had one of these, I just knew I had to get my hands on a mushroom Swiss burger to-go. I don't remember if they had it before. But now online ordering is a thing. And it's easier to use than that of Yahgi's pizza. But...I digress. Customization was easy and you can even order extra fries, in case you aren't able to enjoy their "bottomless fries" feature; which is only available dining in. Oh, and if you haven't been to this place before, you have GOT to try the sweet n' spicy ketchup with the fries. It's literally the only time I ever dip my fries in any kind of ketchup so...that should say something. The burger was as tasty as I remember it. One minor complaint is have is how quickly the bun can get soggy, especially if you ordered to-go with no lettuce. So I guess the tip here is: if you're gonna order a burger to-go, be sure to get one with lettuce on the bottom to protect the bun. Other than that, I'd safely say Red Robin is as good as they were in NC. I'd give them 4 steak fries dipped in sweet n' spicy ketchup out of 5.

My family and I went for the first time in November. We stood at the hostess booth for about 5 minutes before someone came up to greet us and told us they would get us a table in about another 5 minutes... mind you, the place was NOT packed. Food was great but was not impressed with the service. We tried it out again last week.. we still had to wait for a table (which was dirty). The place did not seem busy (it was before noon) and we even waited for almost 10 minutes before the server came to our table! We gave this place a second chance... but I don't think we will be back! We like the "bottomless" side option but the place is not the cleanest and the service is not the greatest!
Horrible service. Food took forever to come out. Then it was cold. The bartender was great but the food was horrible .
I just ordered a black and Bleu burger with sweet potato fries to go. I'm working on the computers at Applebee's. I should have eaten here! The fries are some cold and hard! How disappointing!
The food was fantastic! We waited awhile but it was worth it! Fries were good. It was not busy that day, so that was a plus.

Came with my sister in law for a cheat meal. We were half way done and she found a bug covered with cheese on her plate! It was disgusting! They were very kind about it, said sorry and took it off our bill but we are never going back

Sat at the bar.  Ordered  burger and sombrero salad. Burger and as undercooked and the Patty seemed small for a gourmet burger.  Flavor was good they did have onions on a no onion request, but manager who brought it out did notice it  as he set it down and offered to redo it. The lettuce in salad was a wilted and the amount of the toppings was a bit skimpy.  The flavor was good. Our cocktail did not seem to match the ingredients on menu, instead of just fixing it, it was explained away.   Not sure we'll be back.

Visited when they first opened last year and liked it A lot. My hubby and I came here a few months ago on a Sunday afternoon. I was working and told him I would meet him and his fiend after. When I got there (45 minutes after he told he was there) I noticed there were no drinks. I asked if he ordered his typical Bloody Mary, to which he responded "yeah, but no one came back."  I was asked what I wanted, and when I said a Bloody Mary the bartender said, "yeah, we are out of stuff. S*it. Sorry dude I spaced out in the back". We left, figured it was an off day. It happens.  Came again today. No bartender. Sat at the bar. Said hi to staff walking by. Everyone cleaning up. It wasn't even 8pm. Guess this place can't get staffed or get their stuff together.
Reeeeallllyyyy slow service. Not worth the wait for the food, which really isn't bad - the burgers can be good. Not the most hygienic place though!

Three stars for this new location. I love their set up in this place. Killeen has a ton of places to eat at and its nice to have something different. The service was a bit off, but I think it was due to the busy staff. There were drinks not refilled and French fries that were not refilled since she may have forgotten or lost track. I give this place the standard three stars for the chain service and quality it provides.
Food was ok. Server was ok. Help staff brought wrong food to our table and two others nearby. Don't plan to return here.

Really disappointed...I don't write reviews nor complain too much unless I'm really bothered...our drinks were flat ( up getting pineapple juice for a replacement...even that tasted a little off)...we waited longer then others to receive our food and it was only me and my girlfriend...after 30-40 of waiting we get our food and dig into the fries...by the time we were offered more fries we were already done and ready to go..we started to question if bottomless fries really meant that little holster can thing they first come in lol...I know I have looked pissed off because my girlfriend was describing how upset I looked...when the manager came he asked the group behind us if everything was OK....not someone who was clearly visibly upset with the service...would like to say I won't be going back. PS it wasn't even dinner rush
This is one of the better chain restaurants in the area. You have the usual one around but if your looking for a decent hamburger this is your place. They have unlimited fries so eat up.
The food was really good for a casual dining restaurant. I would definitely come back I received great service and they also have a full bar. I will be swinging by after golf sometime next week.

Omg love these burgers. Get the Pigout Tavern Double if you like Bacon. Burgers are juicy and delicious the fries are hot and fresh the seasoning is to die for!!! The staff is always friendly and courteous. Yeah it can get pricy fast but sooooo worth the money.

Use to go to the one back home so I figured this one would be good.... nope the food was barely decent and there was a LONGGG hair in my food that definitely was not mine. Sadly will not be going back to this restaurant. I had such high hopes only to be let down

First time at any Red Robin location. Service was horrible. I don't even remember the name of the burger I got but it was $13. It was not worth paying that much for something that wasn't even worth a brag. A cheeseburger at Wendy's would've satisfied me. I wouldn't give this place a second try.

Ever single time I've been here the service was AWFUL! I always order the freckled lemonade and it just taste like sugar water with rotten looking strawberries in it.  And every burger I've tried, they all have pretty much a similar taste.  Every server I've had here was awful... I've given this place multiple chances and I'm just done. Won't be returning, ever.. Don't bother wasting your money here. The food is eh and the servers are BAD.

There was food still on the table the hostess claimed to have wiped down. Waited 50 minutes, no food.  Understandable if it was during lunch rush. (We arrive at 1:30).  It wasn't. And definitely wasn't by time we left at 2:23.  Took the waitress 30 minutes to bring our tea out to us, my cup was filled only half way!  We had a booth where we could see straight into the kitchen where you could see employees laughing joking moving from one place to another but not doing anything. Called for the waitress who stated "the food should be out any minute" when we let her know we'd been waiting 45 minutes at that point. She said she would go get our food. Watched her walk back into the kitchen and talked to someone. 3 minutes later, nothing, got up to walk out when manager (?) came up and said, "I can get your food to you right now."  Yet, he didn't have food in hand.  That would have been "right now". Horrible place.  Left hungry.  Don't know or care if their burgers are "yumm" I know their service is "yuck!" I want my hour back.   Having lunch at Fuddruckers!  I'll get an excellent burger and service is always great there.

My experiences here do not match my prior visits to red robins in other cities.   The burgers definitely meet the red robin standard but the bottomless fries always come out luke warm.  Also, they ran out of condiments and toppings.  Sunday (end of the business week for them) or not, it's disappointing.   I do not have plans of returning for another month or 2 until things the basic red robins standards are solved.

Where do I start... Well by far it's been the worst service and food quality I have ever had from Red Robin. I order the blue burger with bacon, I received it with no BACON, my wife order the royal burger with a fully cooked egg, her egg was partially in cooked and ruined the burger.  The waitress never came back to check on us even after pushing the "call waiter" button on the table. I had to ask another server to get my waitress. When she arrived I told her my problem with our order, requested an additional bottle of ketchup since the one at our table was empty... Never arrived. Requested napkins.... Never arrived. We had only on glass of our beverages to never be re filled. My wife and I could not even half way eat our burgers there was something weird about the taste... We should have eaten at Jack in the Box.  Avoid this Red Robin like the plague and avoid the female waitress Ashley. Good luck if you eat at this location.

Red Robin is the place to go for burger and beers!  I had a party of 13 at 6:30pm on opening night, and all factors considered, Red Robin rocked it. We were seated in an hour and fifteen minutes,  which is what they said it would take. The only things that made it not a perfect dinning experience was that our food didn't arrive at the same time, the bar didn't have Stella beer, and was really slow to get my drink out, and the table was not fully equipped with the normal condiments like sweeteners. But again, it was opening night! I give them slack for that, especially because the staff was really friendly and tried hard accommodate everyone and All of the food came out tasting great!  I think they will improve over time and will update my review after a few months.

This place is good. While wait times to be seated can be long, as can wait times for food, the food is great. The sauces, the bottomless fries, and the burgers, no matter what burger you pick, it's gonna be good. Prices aren't too bad either, definitely worth coming here at least once.

My husband and I have been to Red Robin twice, and both times have been incredible because of the quick seating, awesome staff and yummy food! On our last trip there last night, we had the best server ever! Brian has the best personality and was kinder and funnier than any server we've had before! The bottomless fries is definitely something new and wonderful that will keep us coming back as well! Thank you so much for our awesome experience!
Great place to eat, service was on time the waitress was very courteous (TIffany). The food was slamming.

I love this place the food is amazing but I was a little thrown off with the cleanliness of the restaurant last night. When we got to the booth the seats were really wet from the cleaning towel they used and the table was wet as well so my first thought was ew they whipped the table with the same towel they wiped the seat with. It felt gross touching the table with our arms cause the table was still wet but it dried. The waitress was great she brought us silverware and we got them and there was food all over the knife.... and the forks looked really blotchy with dried water stains. We asked for new ones and she apologized nicely. Then we got our food and the plates looked really messy as well. Again with the blotchy dried water stains... the food was good but I kept thinking about how they probably just spray the plates and silverware with water and not even use soap and stuff to clean the dishes.... I dunno I just thought I'd post about this just so the person in the back will try harder.

Not impressed. I ordered a salad and it came in a long flat plate that was hard to use. Every time I tried to cut the lettuce, things would fall out. Never mind trying to cut the chicken. I finally had to ask for another plate to be able to eat. The waitress - who was very nice, by the way - brought me a to go plate where I could mix things in. It was helpful but too much work for a damn salad. On top of that, the salad looked just like bagged ones you buy at Wal-Mart and not at all restaurant made. Don't think I'll be back.

I'm here at Red Robin right now enjoying my lunch, Killeen, Texas.  I decided to give a review immediately so your excellent server, Erika, might get recognition for a good review  before her shift is over.  I stopped coming to this Red Robin because service has been poor since this location first opened.  I only came in today because of a 1/2 off coupon I received by email. The food is delicious as it usually is, but a server who checks up on me, refills my water without having to find the server and who doesn't seem put out when I request something is representative of a great server; a server who should be the model of all armed Robin servers.  That server is Erika, and I will return so long as I get her for a server or someone with her impeccable serving traits. If this experience is just a fluke and I come back to the typical servers here who usually have their "entitlement" personality then I will only come back when you offer 1/2 off coupons as bad service at full price is not a value to me and my family. Good job today, Erika!
Great burgers! Their turkey burger and sweet potato fries tasted awesome! If you want awesome service ask for Bobbie!
Burgers are always good here . Love the fact that the wait staff is honest and tells us what not to order here. Burgers were cook just right and tasted good .

As soon as we walked in on a Friday night we were kindly greeted by the hostess and was seated within 5 minutes. Once we got to our table we were greeted by our waiter, CJ very kind and enthusiastic. Throughout the night not only was he courteous to us but he was also very friendly and complimentary  to the other staff members that helped him out. We both ordered the smoke and pepper burger and I added an additional egg sunny side up on mine. All I can say is amazing!  Oh and the campfire sauce with the onion ring stack.... About halfway through our meal the manager walked by and asked how we were doing.  Over all, for our first visit, it was a pleasant one indeed. We will definitely be back and recommend to our friends.  The only reason I gave it four stars is because the tables are small and I personally am not into the barstool type seating.

Love it!!!   They have recently remodelded. Much more inviting.   The food was excellent and everyone was great.  Highly recommended.  I think it has a new manager.   Everyone seemed happy to be there.  The atmosphere was relaxing.   We really enjoyed ourselves.   The new res tables and chair are super comfortable

Service was atrocious, we had to wait along time just go get our drinks and refills, I just had water.  They were not busy so I was confused.  The two stars was for the food and the waiters and manager were nice just didn't know what they were doing.  Not really a sense of urgency.
First time ever here. Will not be back. 30 minutes to sit down and place was not crowded @ 6:00pm. Took almost another 30 mins for food to arrive.

I was visiting family and it was suggested that we go to Red Robin on a Friday night. This was my very first time and I've had better food. I wasn't too hungry so I ordered cheese fries and boneless wings. The cheese fries were very dry and had slices of dry melted cheese on just few of the fries. Boneless wings were ok could've had more sauce and I wish the waiter told me it came with crumbled blue cheese cause I would've told them to take it off. My girlfriend had a burger that wasn't all that great she said, and she was never offered extra fries although bottomless fries came with her burger. Other than that, I thought the service was nice, everyone seemed up beat for the most part.

The food is usually great however there's a server who's not making the experience match the food quality. I've spoken to the management team because it's been reoccurring. I hope no one has to deal with this server or poor service skills.

My husband and I had dinner here on 4 October 16 around 7:30pm. We were sat quickly. The hostess was friendly. Our waitress on the other hand... She walked up asked "are y'all drinking tonight?" I'm 37 weeks pregnant, so I said not me. She then asked my husband "what about dad, are you getting drunk tonight?" Hey said no. She then went on to tell us she was hoping she would get a table that would get drunk and leave her a big tip. So unacceptable! I had an email for a free Tavern Burger and fries with the purchase of 2 drinks and another entree, I asked to see if this location was participating in the promo, my husband told her what he planned on ordering (the mac and cheese tavern meal) she said she wasn't sure if that counted as an entree, but since she was "the favorite" the manager would do it for her. She brought us our tea, stood there for a second looking really confused, then said, "oh I put your order in, but just so you know my kitchen sucks today, so if your order is wrong it was my kitchen, not me" this was after she mixed up our drinks. My husband and I both have waited tables in the past, and couldn't believe the way she was acting. Her actions were so disrespectful to not only us but to the kitchen staff and restaurant itself. She made us so uncomfortable that we will probably not be returning to this location.  The food was ok, it has definitely gone downhill from when they first opened. My burger was ok, the fries were soggy and had no seasoning on them.

My girlfriend and I had an awesome experience here.  The food and service were excellent and customized just for us! First, we were there on a moderately crowded evening.  We were seated quickly and courteously. We started off with drinks. I had the mojito and she had the Mai tai.  The mojito was very good and I have rarely had a better one.   The drink selection is awesome and seems to offer something for everybody! We both wanted to try a couple of different burgers, so we told our waitress that we were going to order two... and then split them with each other.  When she brought them to us, we fully expected to have to cut them in half ourselves, but they were already cut.  The waitress told us they don't normally do that for presentation reasons, but she had explained what we wanted to do and they cut them for us!!  Both burgers were delicious!! We also shared two types of fries and those to were awesome as well!  We didn't have room for desert,  but promised ourselves we would save room for that next time as the choices look amazing! We will definitely go back again!!!

Red robin: Killeen When asked waitress about appetizers she said order it on the thingy (Interactive menu) App: chips and queso 2/5 Fresh cooked chips, uneven and rushed;inconsistent.  Wait, 45mins and still waiting  Waitress came by twice. Never mentioned any expected time on delivery of our meal. Did however offer a refill on my drink, "10mins" later it arrived.  Southern Charm Burger, presentation was bleak, The ciabatta bread was cold and soggy.  French fries: warm and tasteless. Somehow had guacamole mixed in them.  In the end it was $50 me, my wife and 2 year old child to eat, not saying this place is bad, maybe I got a horrible waitress. But the service here lacked luster. I don't think I'd be returning. RATING: 2/5
Food was good, the voodoo fries are awesome. Biggest issue is the tables are friggin tiny.

TERRIBLE SERVICE.......I sat at the bar, my drink order was taken and delivered. The bartender did not speak to me again the whole time I was there. I had to flag down a waitress to take my order. I finally got it and I was never asked if I needed more fries or if I needed a drink refill. This is no exaggeration, no one else spoke to me while I was there. I will never waste my money here again.

So I learned that you have to pay attention to your bill here. If you play a game on their kiosk that they put on every table, you'll get charged. If you substitute your steak fries with sweet potatoes fries, they'll charge you extra. They won't tell you about these extra charges. I did not see it on the tablet or on the menu but it did end up on my bill.  About the food. The food is mediocre. It was nothing great. My fries and my friends hamburger were brought out to us luke warm. The rest of the food was hot. The assortment of alcohol was limited compared to other restaurants in the area. This place is nothing spectacular and falls short of the other restaurants nearby.
Food was awesome and our server was super friendly! Will surely continue to come here whenever I crave a burger

I was a little disappointed with my first visit. They have a really large menu and alot of desserts but their food just wasn't as good as I was hoping. The "barely battered" broccoli I ordered looked like they were deep fried. The fruffle dessert is supposed to come with 6. I got 5 full ones and half of one of them and there was a small piece of lettuce stuck to it and a few food crumbs in it. I thought that was pretty gross. It's unlikely I will be back here.

Ate here at Red Robin for the first time ever. Hawaii has no Red Robin, so I was excited to try this place. After reading some bad reviews here on Yelp, I did not set my expectations to high. But I was pleasantly surprised. We came here at 11 am on a weekday, so it wasn't to busy. We were seated immediately and our waitress greeted us soon after. She was a friendly and helpful waitress. She asked if it was our first time and when we told her yes, she explained how things worked. We Ordered the "MadLove" Burger with Pineapple and the "Insane Romain" salad. Damn. My burger came out perfect. It was delicious, moist and juicy. It was perfectly cooked and filled with so much flavor. The Grilled romain salad was perfectly dressed and tasted wonderful! We also ordered the Cupcake Milkshake and "Towering Doh! Rings" for dessert. It was just amazing. My husband didn't want to eat here at first. But by the time we finished our meal he was really glad I chose this place. We both had a great experience here. I'm learning that even though a place has bad reviews, your own experience may be a good one.
This place is awesome!!! Great burgers and a wide selection of beers. The deserts are amazing too.

I would give this place no stars if I could. We decided to try this place a try. We sat here for 20 minutes before my wife decided to ask for someone. The waitress said that the person responsible for providing us the service we came for was to busy doing other things. Food might be good but to wait for substandard service is unacceptable. Go to billy bobs burgers if you would like a good burger and amazing service. I had enough time to create a Yelp account to tell you the public about this. I still have not received my food. I sat down at 9:00 and it's now 9:50. Everyone is sitting around me with their faces resting in their palms. This place needs to get itself together. Read the review from "Caleb m.". He speaks the truth. Just got my food. After closing at 10:18. 10:30 update: I am giving this place another two stars purely on the managers sincerity. I asked to speak with him and to explained to me the situation at hand. He took over as my server and gave us our food for free. The food was decent. I'll probably come back again in a month or two when their staff are more seasoned.
As happens in Killeen restaurants start out well, but end up in the trash heap. Water had raw meat, server nonexistent, manager didnt care. What else can I say, but we wont be going back.
Second visit! Once again, great customer service. Did not disappoint. Love this place!

My husband and I came to eat tonight at 9:45 and we walked in the door the cook from the back ran out and said we have no Burgers I just cuz you clean the grill you still have 15 minutes and decided not to serve us that's okay we won't be coming back
You are already in Killeen so take your ass to Billy Bob's and treat yourself. I've had better burgers in a dining facility in Iraq.

Where to begin. If I could give less than one star I would. Our waitress started off the conversation with complaining about how people weren't tipping her because she had tattoos and that the people that werent tipping her were probably Christians. We are a family of Christians and we have tattoos but thats beside the point. After taking our order we did not see our waitress until we were ready to leave. Other staff brought our food and drinks. The burgers were okay. A little over cooked from what we ordered and the fries came out cold.

The food was pretty bland and not really a lot better than McDonalds.  Lukewarm food never pleases me and there is no reason to pay 20 bucks for a lukewarm burger and lukewarm fries.  I will not go back.

Our experience here was not consistent with other red robins. The waiter started by telling us about 6 things not to order.  I appreciate him being honest about the menu, but nothing positive was offered.   We ordered an appetizer that never arrived.  The waiter did ask if our child wanted some fries to start out, which we thought was really thoughtful.  The fries never came, so we asked for his food to be delivered as soon as possible.  It still took about 20 min (mini corn dogs) and his drink was never delivered after 1 follow up request.   The rest of our food arrived about 15 min later.   We ordered sauces with our meals and followed up on them 3 additional times.  They were delivered after everyone at the table had finished our meals.  After all was said and done it took us nearly 2 hours to eat dinner here.   To be fair, the waiter was working hard throughout  the restaurant the entire night.   We saw 2 other waitresses and they were working very hard also.  I honestly believe the restaurant was understaffed and that led to most of our issues.  I don't know if we got unlucky or if this is a management issue.   The food was good, as is expected from our other trips to other red robin restaurants.  I would not go here again with so many dining options in Killeen.

Very good first experience. Great service, great food and decent prices! Burgers were awesome and there are many options for everyone. The garlic fries were very good and garlicky. Beautiful restroom and very clean. Beautiful bar and the management was actually managing!

They feed you cheap booze! My wife asked for chilled,  dressed shots of Don Julio Tequila. Instead of telling us they did not carry that tequila they gave her shots of cheap tequila even changing the name in the system to make it look like Don Julio. When I called them on it the first time, the waiter told me I was mistaken and brought me another round of shitty shots. I went to ask the bartender if they had Don Julio Tequila, after a bit of squirming they told me it was cheap tequila and they would only charge me for the cheap shoots. After explaining that I would not paying to have someone shit in my mouth I ate my very pathetic ghost Burger and left, never to return.
Burgers was good. The freckled lemonade was not so gees nor was the sweet tea (Gold Peak). The steak fries was good just don't get enough.

Food was ok but our waitress wasn't friendly much. She looked like she didn't want to be at work. When she  brought our food didn't say a word, not even to ask if we needed anything else. Definitely won't be coming back to this location again.

This is a fairly new restaurant in this area and I was excited to be trying a new gourmet burger.  I chose and really enjoyed the Mushroom Swiss Burger. The Popping Purple Lemonade was good as well for lemonade drinkers. Checking out was fairly difficult, they offer little tablets that allow you to split the checks amongst the party.  The tablet we had was functioning properly so it took approximately 30mins just to pay after completing our meals.

Excellent food as always and also a very clean place with cool stuff. However, we had to wait about 45-50 minutes for 2 burgers. While we waited out empty glasses and empty plates just there the entire time without being cleaned up or refilled. I get that the kitchen can be backed up but if you know that at least keep your customers happy with refills and a cleaned table.

Me and my hubby had a great experience here! The blonde girl who greeted us at the front wasn't very friendly, but our waitress Kaela was very sweet and attentive. She approached us right after we got seated, and our order took no longer than 15 minutes total. The bleu ribbon burger and garlic fries were to die for! Everything was fresh and delicious! The mountain mudd pie (or whatever it's called) was a delicious chocolatey goodness! Throughout our visit Kaela made sure we have everything we need, and made our visit very pleasant. If you ever come here definitely ask for her!

Wow.....waited to be seated ...hostess brought us to our booth then says oh sorry a server took it to eat on her break. We have to find you another booth....first time here...first impression...NOT GoOD

Poor service. Insanely long wait to be seated. Was told 25 minutes and it ended up being well over an hour. Just before being seated, I heard them telling people 40 minutes even though the crowd was twice as large as when I arrived. Manager did nothing about them underestimating the time despite multiple complaints. Manager even said they had this problem during their sneak peek and they have done nothing to rectify the situation  (such as opening the patio or the back room). It is a family oriented restaurant that more than half the space is taken by the bar area, and they are not allowed to seat families in the bar area. Overall a poorly planned restaurant destined to disappoint many.
Glad there's finally one in town. Great staff, above average food and beverages. Looking forward to trying different things on the menu.
Great place! Food was absolutely fantastic and the service was not bad at all, from the entering of the restaurant to the exiting they always made sure all was as we expected.

Went here for my birthday yesterday and it was good, but I have been a long time fan of this chain. This is a new location but the staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Food was excellent so was the service and the margarita... Only problem was it did seem a bit dirty for a new location. Staff definitely needs to clean tables and restaurant area better. Not disgusting but not up to most people's standard for a food chain restaurant. I'll probably go back again.

Food was great. I had the turkey burger as that is my usual preference. Burger came fully dressed as requested with cheddar cheese and had a wonderful char-broiled taste and texture. The complimentary onion ring tower was really good, however I prefer ketchup to the two sauces provided. Fries came with the burger and those were way above average with a semi-crispy exterior and a puffy "baked potato" texture inside. My wife had a patty melt which she anointed as the "Best Ever." Our server, Jessica was very helpful and knowledgeable about the menu which was great since this RR location had just opened the day before our visit. Yummmm! - FYI: Our visit was a pre-opening training run. I was pleased to see that the public was allowed to partake rather than just the usual "dignitaries."

I enjoyed the best burger I've ever had here in mid-November for my birthday. Our fries came out cold but they immediately replaced them. Waitress was super nice and food came out way fast. I was impressed seeing they had just opened and it was packed. My new favorite place to eat around here!
We went when it was just opened. The hostesses were super rude. Food is good but super pricey.

My husband brought me to Red Robins for my birthday today, we only waited about 7-10 minutes even though it was supposed to be a 40 minute wait for a table, so I was happy about that. Our waiter SHAYLA was NOT engaging at all I guess she assumed that since my husband and myself were African American that were not going to tip her so she just took our food order, she never asked if we wanted water even though we had alcoholic beverages, never checked on us to see if we needed anything and didn't explain the self order/checkout zoosk worked, she didn't even ask us if we wanted desert. The food on the other hand for being my first time trying Red Robins was excellent and cooked very well. The next the we go there we're going to ask for the waitress HEAVEN, she was the waiter for the people that was next to us and was VERY attentive to her tables.

The only reason this is even getting 2 stars is because the food really was great and the bar tender was on point. As for service! My friend arrived at 5pm to reserve a table for 10 he was told 25 mins  I arrived at 6 which was our scheduled dinner plans. We waited at the bar for over an hour and a half. My friend went up to the greeter and they forgot about us apparently. The waiter walked off without even finishing taking our drink and appetizer order. Later he came in and was complaining about the bartender be slow and not doing their job (mind you had fabulous service at the bar before being seated). Don't complain about your co-workers to patrons. Overall great food bad service!
The burger and fries I had was delicious. Our server was great and very attentive. I'm definitely looking forward to my next visit.
The "Chicken Bliss" should be the name of the new chicken burger. Xenia H.

Our party of seven was seated relatively promptly; but that was, unfortunately, the highlight of the meal.  It took the waiter at least 15 minutes to take our drink orders and then another 15 minutes to take our food orders.  Two skimpy baskets of fries were delivered to the table the whole time we were there.  My order was French onion soup and a BLT croissant.  The French onion soup was inedible; it tasted like the cook had dumped an entire cup of salt into my bowl.  I sent it back.  The croissant was completely tasteless - even the bacon, which should be impossible.  The three people in my party who ordered burgers waited a half hour for their burgers.  The rest of us were almost finished with our food before the burgers came.  The manager came to apologize but there was no discount given for the lateness.  In addition, the burgers were tasteless and under-seasoned.  Unlike other reviewers, I don't cut restaurants slack for being new.  If they're ready to take my money - a process which seemed to go pretty smoothly - they should be ready with good food served promptly.  If not, then all of their food should be half price while they're practicing on patrons.

Let me tell you, folks...this is THE place to go for a hamburger! Charbroiled, delicious patty and fresh veggies...GRILLED bun...oh, my...burger heaven. The onion rings were superb, thick, crisp, yummy. My husband had a super gourmet burger with barbecue sauce and his audible sighs of pleasure were an indication of how much he enjoyed it. The "bottomless" fries were hot and fresh. My mother loved her fish and chips  (she shared--so good). If you like malts, these are the best. Root beer floats are just delish, too. Drinks were replenished promptly. And, as always, the service is superior--friendly, super competent, helpful. Big screen TV's in every corner. Very cool decor (artfully arranged bottles hanging from the ceiling). Families are welcomed, but great for date night, too. I have to say I have yet to visit a Red Robin and be disappointed. The management at this Killeen location seems to really be on top of everything...very friendly, approachable, and together. This was a training session, but we were treated and served the same way we always are in these restaurants--like royalty. So thrilled they are finally in our town! We'll be back...and back...and back...

Arrived to a half full restaurant. The hostess wanted to seat us at a tiny two top right next to a large booth with a big party at it. I requested a different table and we waited 15 more minutes. Got to our (dirty) booth and sat for another 10 minutes waiting for a server. A guy came out, talked to another table, said he would be "right with us" and disappeared. We left and definitely won't return to this Red Robin.

Kid friendly, but bad customer service. Our waiter was rude, and my burger tasted burnt and dry. My husband got a bad stomach virus the next day, but not 100% sure it was from here, but huge possibility. The only reason I gave 3 stars is because my daughter's food was good, most restaurants kid food tastes microwaved. && there was neat little chalk boards and stuff to keep her entertained.

I went in just after 5:00 p.m. as I was staying in a hotel just behind the restaurant.  Approximately 1/3 of the table were occupied.  When I told the hostess I was dining alone she asked; "Do you want to sit at the bar with no waiting?".  I thought she was kidding since there were obviously so many empty tables and booths.  So imagine my surprise when I answered "no" and she replied (in a nasty tone); "Then it will be a 5. to 10 minute wait", turned on her heels and walked away. No burger is worth that kind of treatment.  Needless to say I walked out immediately but I did look up the number and phoned (twice) to inform the manager of this rude hostess.  No one ever answered the phone, either time I called.  REALLY POOR MANAGEMENT!  I went next door and had a lovely burger.

Waited at our table for about 20 minutes for service until we were asked if we needed anything from a waiter. She said our waiter was too busy with other tables. We didn't receive our food till an hour later. (Even though we ordered our food with our drinks.) We almost got up and left before we received our food but we decided to speak to the manager. The manager Billy was very nice and apologized about our wait and took care of our bill. The burgers where delicious. This is why I'm giving it 4 stars. Btw don't order the garlic and herb fries they are not worth the up charge.

Came here for the first time ever and I didn't know what to expect. All though I came on a Saturday evening and it was very busy I didn't have to wait a long time to be seated. The burger and fries was delicious!!!!! I so recommend this place! Great service as well !! Very happy they opened one in Killeen.
The hostess Alexis was amazing at making us feel welcome when we walked in the door. Darius, the waiter, was spectacular. Food came out fast, hot, and delicious.

SOME STRAIGHT ASS...I paid 12 dollars for 6 shrimp and 2 chicken tenders after the waitress told me I would get 4...I asked for mac and cheese on the side and it came with nasty ass Cole slaw...then I waited 10 min for my mac n cheese but really it was just noodles with cheese melted on top...horrible experience

I love red robin that's why I came here. Although the Killeen red robin is nothing to stay for, I received my meal and found a hair, they didn't offer to remake the burger or comp our meal. I find this establishment a disgrace after this current experience.

Wish I had gotten the name of our bartender tonight because he was great; put the Giants game on for me and checked on us frequently throughout the meal. Food here is fine, nothing special but decent and the drinks are pretty good. We'll be back!
My wife and I were treated like Gold by shaunda and the cook 5 stars bro! Just amazing, the service and atmosphere was perfect!

We sat down.  30 minutes goes by.  Then a waiter (the one serving every table around us) comes by and says that he's sorry for the wait with a plethora of excuses (not his table, the girl working the table left early...).  Then I ask him if they have a kids menu, to which he replies "they didn't even get you a kids menu?".  He goes away and after waiting another 5 minutes we decided to go to IHOP instead.  Before I left I asked for the manager (another 3 minute wait).  A guy named "Bill" came out and I asked him if he was the manager, to which he just extended his hand and repated his name again.  Instead of getting into a pissing match with him, I just smiled and explained my disappointment with his establishment.  He offered no comps or even an apology.  He just said that's not how they usually do business and offered to seat us again.  To which I replied "The kids want to go to IHOP now," and he replied with "well come back another time and give us another try".  Needless to say, unless they offer me and my family a free meal or someone I'm with really wants to go, I won't be visiting this establishment anytime in the near future.

LOVE it, been here a dozen time since they opened. Has quickly become my favorite. Other then a terrible waitress one day for lunch everytime I have been there staff has been great, food is ALWAYS cooked to perfection never a complaint.

The three stars are solely for the super delicious burgers. The service I experienced was horrible. It took a while I get seated which I completely understand being that it was pretty busy. I didn't have a problem with that. The waiter was nice, but was getting super close to us when he was talking and I don't think he understood it made us uncomfortable. It took forever for us to actually get our food and forget getting refills on our drinks. And I love bottomless fries but it took forever for some to come out so it wasn't worth asking for more. This place would probably be better to come to when it's not so busy.

We had the worst service from the time we sat down until the time we left. We went there and they were pretty busy, but well staffed. Waited 20 minutes for a table which was typical for Killeen. When we got seated we waited another 10 minutes for our waitress. The restaurant cleared out quite a bit by the time our waitress showed up. She asked if we had been there before and and we told her that my wife had, but I and my son had not. She went over the reward program, which we informed her we already were members and that we should have our names in the system. She explained the free birthday burger and I told her it was my birthday, and asked if I would be receiving my free burger to which she rudely told me that since it was my birthday, that the staff was "going to embarrass the hell out me". I told her not to. Which she complied. We ordered drinks and waited 10 minutes to receive, and had to wait more time so the waitress could sing happy birthday to another table. We waited another 25 minutes for our food. Then waited another 10 minutes for fry sauce, 10 minutes after ordering a refill, received no refills on our bottomless fries, then took another 20 minutes to get our check. I never did receive a receipt, nor did I get my change back. We were very displeased with our service and will not be returning.
Not having a good time here. Waiting on a pick up order I called in and after 5 minutes standing at the bar where they told me to at the door. 2 stars is too many. Getting angry and hangry.

Beyond impressed..!!! If you're in the area looking for a new place to spend your cash, this is it..!! Extremely accommodating service from the front desk staff, personable waiters, courteous management and the food... Oh my goodness out of this world excellent. To start, the milkshake was delicious, the onion rings were perfectly crunchy and the dipping sauce is something spectacular, the whisky burger was quoted as "the best burger I've ever had in my life" and the southern burger with brown sugar and candid bacon was finger licking delicious. I am just so pleased that Red Robin chose our little city. Driving by these past months all I could think of was "not another burger joint" however, after visiting their soft opening today, I can say that this is NOT your ordinary burger spot. It's a great place to take your family or a date. I even witnessed the staff escorting people to their cars due to the massive storm. I do hope they continue to keep up the fine service I experienced today. One more thing.... The restaurant was a comfortable temperature. Most of our area restaurants have the AC set on -32 degrees and I normally have to bring a throw or eat with my jacket on, nothing is more annoying than eating uncomfortably. Overall, I give this place a 5/5. RED Robin yummmmm!!

This restaurant just opened at the beginning of November. I have been here 5 times this month. I sat both at a table and the bar during this month.  First a review of my food and drink selections. My favorite dish is the Ensenada Chicken Platter. The chicken was perfectly cooked and spiced (I love spice). The chicken was accompanied by a salad that was both fresh and flavorful. I also loved the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken sandwich as well as the salad of the same name. The Prime Rib Dip was edible, but nothing great. There was some gristle, and the meat was slightly tough. As for accompaniments, I usually substitute cole slaw for the fries. The cole slaw was good except for the time I got an order that was just shredded cabbage. I also got a Name That Burger. The burger was cooked as per my request. It was moist. Other than that, I didn't care for the burger because it was too bland for me. There was way too much sauce on the burger. For a drink, I had the unsweetened raspberry tea. It is made with Monin syrup which is one of my favorite brands. It was good. I also had the Fresh Lime Skinny Margarita which I chose to have on the rocks. You can also get it frozen. I love that drink. It was fresh, flavorful, and not too sweet. Be sure to ask for salt on the rim. Now for the service. Be prepared to wait...for everything. If you are in a hurry, go to another restaurant. There is a long wait for food. I asked for customizations on all of my orders. It was right 50% of the time. The best service I had was at the bar during dinner. There is a bartender who is truly amazing--Alyssa. She got my food and drink orders right, and she works as quickly and efficiently as she can. She also had to ring me out because there weren't enough pads for all the customers at the bar. Unfortunately, there was still a lot of waiting because they needed another person behind the bar to wait on customers--at least on Friday night. The worst service I had was at the bar during lunch which was much less crowded than dinner. I wasn't given a pad so I had to rely on the bartender to ring me out. First, she couldn't figure out how to do a gift card, and then she couldn't figure out how to get the membership number on the bill so I got credit for the visit. I called customer service when I got home to resolve that issue. Hopefully, service will improve with training and experience. I am not going back to eat for a while.

I'd like to start out by saying that not all Red Robins are bad. But after waiting ten minutes for a shake, and then twenty minutes for a refill on drinks and fries, I don't see myself returning. It may be a busy Tuesday afternoon, but it doesn't mean we need to be sitting around waiting for what is supposed to be a gourmet burger. The technology you guys are using might be to help speed things up, but your lack of staff is slowing things down. Not once did I see a manager come around asking how things are going or I wouldn't be writing this review now. Here I sit, for an extra twenty minutes on top of everything, waiting on my husbands SECOND root beer float. If that even happens.
Great service great food. I am so glad Killeen got a red robin. We love it. We will be here about once a week. Keep up the great work.

One of the worst visit! As a group it was our first visit and it was my first visit ever to a Red Robin (also my last). We asked for a table because some of us would have difficulty using their tall stools, so we had to wait. When we were finally seated, low and behold it was a very closed in crowded area with tall stools. The food was not very good and the service was awful! One individual in our party had to return her meal 3 times and it was only a cheeseburger, plain and dry. How hard is that?? She finally got her meal after the rest of us had finished ours. We repeatedly stopped different wait staff individuals because ours had disappeared. Our waiter finally showed up when we were ready to leave. We asked for our ticket. A couple of us wanted to pay with cash and he told us that we had to use the electronic pay. What??? Since when is cash not a good thing? My guess was that he wasn't capable of counting money.  I don't see this place staying open for very long if they continue in this manner.
